Hyeri

Korean: 이혜리

Hometown:

Sam-ri, Gonjiam-eup, Gwangju, Gyeonggi-do

Country:

South Korea

Full name:
Lee Hye Ri
Native name:
이혜리
Birthday:
Jun 9, 1994
Age:
30 years old
Blood type:
AB
Height:
5'6" (167 cm)
Weight:
119 lbs (54 kg)
Group (2010-2019):
Girl's Day

Introduction

Hyeri is a South Korean dancer, singer, rapper, variety star, actress, and model under SUBLIME. She is a member of the South Korean girl group Girl's Day.

Hyeri, along with Yura, joined the girl group Girl's Day, under DreamT Entertainment, in September 2010 after the departures of members Jisun and Jang Hyeri (known as Ji In at the time). Her first release with the group was the digital single "Girl's Day Party #2", which was released on October 29, 2010. Despite the four members being in separate agencies now, they have stated that the group has not disbanded.

In 2012, she made her acting debut in the drama "Tasty Life", which aired from April to September 2012.

In August 2014, Hyeri appeared in the variety show "Real Men". After a brief clip of her went viral, she rose to fame and won "Best Female Newcomer" at the MBC Entertainment Awards for her appaerance in the variety show.

In 2015, she was cast as the female lead of the drama "Reply 1988", which became one of the highest rated dramas in Korean television. Due to its success, it made her even more known, earning her a lot of praise for her acting skills.

Following Girl's Day's hiatus, she pursued acting, playing main roles in various dramas, such as "Two Cops" in 2017, "Miss Lee" in 2019, "My Roommate is a Gumiho" in 2021, "Moonshine" in 2022, and "Friendly Rivalry" in 2025. She also played in movies, making her big screen debut in 2017 as the female lead of the movie "Monstrum", as well as playing in movies like "My Punch-Drunk Boxer" in 2019, and "Victory" in 2024.

Aside from that, Hyeri appeared in multiple variety shows where she was apart of the main cast such as tvN's "DoReMi Market", also known as "Amazing Saturday", from 2018 to 2020, ENA's "HMLYCP", also known as "HyeMiLeeYeChaePa" in 2023, as well as the Netflix's web reality show "Agent of Mystery" in 2024. She is considered a "blue-chip" in the industry due to her personality, being easy-going and bright, as well as having flexible chemistry with her co-host and co-stars.

After her exclusive contract with DreamT Entertainment ended on September 11, 2019, Hyeri joined a newly set-up agency Creative Group ING on April 30, 2019. In June 2024, it was reported that she signed with SUBLIME.
